org.jetel.data.formatter

Class XLSFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.formatter.AbstractFormatter
      • org.jetel.data.formatter.XLSFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Formatter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JExcelXLSDataFormatter, XLSXDataFormatter

    public abstract class XLSFormatter
extends AbstractFormatter
    Formats records for xls file. Order of method calling:
    • init(DataRecordMetadata)
    • setDataTarget(File)
    • setSheetName(String) or setSheetNumber(int) - optional
    • setFirstRow(int) - optional
    • setFirstColumn(int) - optional
    • setNamesRow(int) - optional
    • prepareSheet()
    • write(DataRecord)
    • close()
    Since:
    15th January 2007

      The type of a XLS(X) that should be used.

      • XLSFormatter

        public XLSFormatter(boolean append,
            boolean removeSheets)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        append - indicates if append data to existing xls sheet or replace them by new data
        removeSheets - indicates if all sheets are to be removed from a file

      • init

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • prepareSheet

        public abstract void prepareSheet()
        Prepares sheet in xls file, which was set by method setSheetName(String sheetName) or setSheetNumber(int sheetNumber) for saving data. If any of above methods wasn't called there is created new sheet with default name.

      • prepareSheet

        public abstract void prepareSheet(DataRecord record)
        Prepares sheet in xls file, which name is created from given record. Before calling this method, setKeyFields(String[]) method must be called.
        Parameters:
        record -

      • setKeyFields

        public void setKeyFields(java.lang.String[] fieldNames)
        Sets from which fields from input metadata will be created sheet name for different records
        Parameters:
        fieldNames -

      • setSheetName

        public void setSheetName(java.lang.String sheetName)
        Set name of sheet, data will be written to. It has higher prioryty then setSheetNumber method
        Parameters:
        sheetName -

      • setSheetNumber

        public void setSheetNumber(int sheetNumber)
        Set number of sheet, data will be written to. If there was called method setSheetName before calling prepareSheet, this number will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        sheetNumber -

      • getCellNum

        public static short getCellNum(java.lang.String cellCode)
                        throws javax.naming.InvalidNameException
        This method calculates xls colum number from its code: A='A'-65=0,B='B'-65,....,Z='Z'-65=CELL_NUMBER_IN_SHEET-1, XYZ = ('X'-64)*CELL_NUMBER_IN_SHEET^2+('Y'-64)*CELL_NUMBER_IN_SHEET+('Z'-65)
        Parameters:
        cellCode -
        Returns:
        column's number from its code
        Throws:
        javax.naming.InvalidNameException

      • getCellCode

        public static java.lang.String getCellCode(int cellNumber)
        This method finds xls column code from its number (0 based)
        Parameters:
        cellNumber -
        Returns:
        column's code from its number

      • finish

        public void finish()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        This method writes all data (header, body, footer) which are to write, but doesn't close underlying streams. TODO remove this method, Formatter.flush() is good enough, see CL-2196
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public boolean isInMemory()
        Returns:
